title: Chinese language
summary: Chinese (simplified Chinese: 汉语; traditional Chinese: 漢語; pinyin: Hànyǔ[lower-alpha 2] or also 中文; Zhōngwén,[lower-alpha 3] especially for the written language) is a group of languages that form the Sinitic branch of the Sino-Tibetan languages, spoken by the ethnic Han Chinese majority and many minority ethnic groups in Greater China. About 1.3 billion people (or approximately 16% of the world's population) speak a variety of Chinese as their first language.[3]
